par.text: Uranium is a silvery-white, radioactive metal belonging to the actinide series. It is ductile and malleable. The radioactivity of uranium was discovered in 1896 by the French physicist Antoine Henri Becquerel. The longest-lived uranium isotope is
years. Uranium is chemically active. It reacts with oxygen, producing the yellow uranium(VI) oxide

, and with water, especially when hot. It dissolves in acids to form salts, but does not react with alkalis. The element was discovered in 1789 by the German chemist Martin Heinrich Klaproth, and isolated in 1841 by Euge
ne Melchior Péligot. It was named after the planet Uranus, discovered a few years before the element.
